page.title: 04LIFESTYLES VILLAGE MORELEIGH
page.content: The local pub at Moreleigh is called The New Inn - it serves bar snacks and is well known for its steaks. Bed and breakfast accommodation is available at several houses in Moreleigh and the nearest Hotel is at Stanborough, which has accommodation for 14 guests. There are two Caravan Club sites, each for five vans. Historically Moreleigh was more important than today, but never significantly so. The name is spelt variously Morlei (Domesday) Morley and today Moreleigh. The road from Gara Bridge is believed to be of Roman origin. In 1315 Moreleigh was granted a Charter for a market and a two day Fair, to be held at the Festival of Mary Magdalene. Remains of a former Manor House are at Place Barton. In the 16th Century Moreleigh was owned by the Champernowne family.
